events.description: The Baltic Exchange’s dry bulk index retreated for a fourth straight session on Thursday.

facts.fact_text: The Baltic Dry Index fell approximately 1% to 1,936 points, reaching its lowest level since January 26.

evidences.evidence_text: falling about 1% to a new low since January 26 at 1,936 points

facts.fact_text: The capesize index decreased by 1.4% to 2,951 points.

evidences.evidence_text: The capesize index, which typically transports 150,000-ton cargoes such as iron ore and coal, decreased by 1.4% to 2,951 points

facts.fact_text: The panamax index dropped by 1.5% to 1,659 points.

evidences.evidence_text: the panamax index, which usually carries 60,000-70,000 tons of coal or grain, slumped by 1.5% to 1,659 points

facts.fact_text: The supramax index rose 0.9% to 1,102 points, its highest level since December 24 of the previous year.

evidences.evidence_text: the smaller suprmax index rose 0.9% to its highest since December 24 last year at 1,102 points

evidence.evidence_text: tracks rates for vessels transporting dry commodities
typically transports 150,000-ton cargoes such as iron ore and coal
usually carries 60,000-70,000 tons of coal or grain
